ygData.subject: Re: Something...
ygData.msgSnippet: An erudite wizard with high intelligence would die like flies when the enemy hits him/her. Dwaven Clerics already has very good states except for
ygData.messageBody:
An erudite wizard with high intelligence would die like flies when the enemy
hits him/her.

Dwaven Clerics already has very good states except for intelligence/charisma.
Where you throw it won't effect it much, but intelligence must be dumped into.

For clerics, dwarf has the best overall stats so they are a good choice.

Since a cleric aim is to eventually use plate mail, the elves/erudite aren't a
good choice.

Gnome having low wisdom is also not recommanded.

Other than lousy intelligence, halfling are okay clerics.

Humans as usual are not a bad choice.

LKW wrote:

> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>
> Wah, u got a point there, hehe.
>
> Anyone ever try creaing an erudite wiz with all bonus point throw to INT?
> The thought sound cool, but dunno what problem this char will encounter in
> long run.
>
> How abt a dwarf cleric with equally high STR, STA and WIS or all throw to
> WIS? Talk abt cleric, which race, in ya opinion, make the easiest cleric
> (ie most powerful)?
>
> Hope u guys dun mind I rise so many questions, coz I enjoy asking and
> finding new info abt all char in EQ :)
>
> On Monday, June 14, 1999 6:03 PM, Sereph [SMTP:garford@...]
> wrote:
> > That will still make a SK do too much damage for his/her level.
> >
> > Imagine this. A level 1 TSK walks up to DVinn, use harm touch on him,
> when run
> > away. Other players later manage to kill DVinn, but all the XP went to
> the TSK,
> > making up level up a lot of levels. So, it's very hard to balance the
> ability
> >
> > LKW wrote:
> >
> > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > >
> > > Wah liao, EQ staff really &*%$$@! How can they be so unfair (as
> compared
> > > to Paladin which never fail to lay hand)? They shld make it that it
> CANNOT
> > > be resisted yet it only reduce the CURRENT HP of the victim. Eg, 1st
> TSK
> > > reduce monster HP life (100%) by half, and 2nd TSK can only reduce it
> by
> > > half of current 50% HP, ie 25%, which left the monster with 25% HP. ;(
> > >
> > > On Monday, June 14, 1999 5:42 PM, Sereph [SMTP:garford@...]
> > > wrote:
> > > > At first, Harm Touch cannot be resisted and does damage = 1/2 of the
> > > total HP a
> > > > target has. But then, people abuse it.
> > > >
> > > > With 2 SK, anything could be killed without any problem.
> > > >
> > > > The problem with most sites on the net is that info was all taken
> from
> > > the beta
> > > > and was never changed. (One example, many site still list that
> Paladin
> > > can't
> > > > use a bow)
> > > >
> > > > LKW wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > No need to shake head lah, only discussion mah. ;)
> > > > >
> > > > > Harm touch can be resisted? Doh, I read from the net that it's
> > > something
> > > > > which cannot be resisted, just like Paladin's lay hand. No?
> > > > >
> > > > > Anyway, learn alot from ya msg, thou kinda different from what I
> read
> > > from
> > > > > the net. Nevertheless it's useful for all to consider when making
> a
> > > new
> > > > > char.
> > > > >
> > > > > Mondain.
> > > > >
> > > > > On Monday, June 14, 1999 5:25 PM, Sereph
> [SMTP:garford@...]
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > *shakes head*
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The grass will always appear greener on the other side unless
> you've
> > > been
> > > > > there
> > > > > > before. so far, with my experience of EQ since the 3rd beta, I
> have
> > > mess
> > > > > around
> > > > > > with Shadow Knights, Paladins, Enchanters, Necros, Shamans and
> > > Magicians.
> > > > > The
> > > > > > other classes I have not much experiences with so I won't
> comment.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The problem with Shadow knight is this.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > At first glance, harm touch appears to be very powerful, dealing
> 10 X
> > > > > level + 1
> > > > > > damage, but what many people don't know is that:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > 1. Harm Touch is counted as an alteration spell. IOWs, it can be
> > > > > resisted.
> > > > > > 2. Being alteration in nature, part of its damage can be
> resisted.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > On average, with a level 13 TSK, I constantly do around 70-80
> damage,
> > > not
> > > > > the
> > > > > > full 131 I expect it to do and miss twice ever 10 times I tyr.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Unless you choose Dark Elf or Humans as a SK, you would not be
> able
> > > to
> > > > > cast
> > > > > > spells the level you get them, as Ogres and Trolls have an aweful
> > > > > intelligence
> > > > > > score, which bring about another problem, Troll/Orge Shadow
> Knight
> > > gains
> > > > > skills
> > > > > > at a painful pace. They often find themselves unable to reach the
> > > skill
> > > > > cap of
> > > > > > their level.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > On regenaration, at low levels, it is a fantastic thing, but at
> high
> > > > > level,
> > > > > > nothing functions better than a real healing spell.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > At level 40, an average TSK is expected to have around 1200 hp
> and
> > > would
> > > > > expect
> > > > > > to take any where from 200-800 hp worth of damage per battle.
> Even
> > > with
> > > > > > regenaration, it is still take around 10-20mins to regenerate the
> > > amount.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Thus, the TSK is not really able to solo at high levels. Level
> 1-15
> > > is
> > > > > easy,
> > > > > > but after this range, due to slow level advancement and an
> unreliable
> > > way
> > > > > of
> > > > > > healing, they can't solo well.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The advantage TSK have over other hybrid warrior classes is that
> they
> > > can
> > > > > still
> > > > > > bash when using 2 handed slashing weapons.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Troll Shamans are worse off. Being a priest class, they will
> never
> > > gain
> > > > > > additional attack, and damage they deal is capped. At level 16,
> you
> > > reach
> > > > > your
> > > > > > melee damage cap.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > In addition Shamans don't really have fantastic direct damage
> spells
> > > nor
> > > > > good
> > > > > > healing ability so soloing past 16 is hard/near impossible.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Troll Warriors fair slightly better than TSK as they hit harder,
> > > faster
> > > > > and has
> > > > > > more HP, but they still need reliable backup to reach high
> levels.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Monks I agree is one of the best class to solo with. The various
> > > special
> > > > > > attacks do a lot of damage and mend, at high level almost never
> fail.
> > > > > Healing
> > > > > > 1/4 of your HP every 6 minutes is damn useful.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Priest class can never solo well unless they go to areas where
> their
> > > > > wards
> > > > > > spell can be use (Befallen for Clerics, Elemental Planes for
> Druids)
> > > else
> > > > > they
> > > > > > fare very badly against normal enermies
> > > > > >
> > > > > > For Wizards, the only way they solo is Root -> Damage spells,
> damage
> > > > > > spells.......
> > > > > >
> > > > > > If root runs out, they're toast, and most would dash towards the
> > > entrance
> > > > > > bringing trains....... A very common sight.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > IMO, these class can solo pretty well from mid to high levels.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Monks
> > > > > > Necros (Provided that nessesary spells could be researched)
> > > > > > Magicians (Same as Necro)
> > > > > > Enchanters (Only after Tashani, Beguile and Clam)
> > > > > >
